BSDA
  • Home
  • Reference
  • Alan T. Arnholt

Live birth rates in 1990 and 1998 for all states

Data for Exercise 1.10

Birth

Format

A data frame with 51 observations on the following three variables.

state
a character with levels Alabama Alaska Arizona Arkansas California Colorado Connecticut Delaware District of Colunbia Florida Georgia Hawaii Idaho Illinois Indiana Iowa Kansas Kentucky Louisiana Maine Maryland Massachusetts Michigan Minnesota Mississippi Missour Montana Nebraska Nevada New Hampshire New Jersey New Mexico New York North Carolina North Dakota Ohio Oklahoma Oregon Pennsylvania Rhode Island South Carolina South Dakota Tennessee Texas Utah Vermont Virginia Washington West Virginia Wisconsin Wyoming
rate
live birth rates per 1000 population
year
a factor with levels 1990 and 1998

References

Kitchens, L. J. (2003) Basic Statistics and Data Analysis. Duxbury

Examples


rate1998 <- subset(Birth, year == "1998", select = rate, drop = TRUE)
stem(x = rate1998, scale = 2)
#> 
#>   The decimal point is at the |
#> 
#>   11 | 015
#>   12 | 223479
#>   13 | 0012466888999
#>   14 | 0001222334567788
#>   15 | 023678
#>   16 | 00248
#>   17 | 3
#>   18 | 
#>   19 | 
#>   20 | 
#>   21 | 5
#> 
hist(rate1998, breaks = seq(10.9, 21.9, 1.0), xlab = "1998 Birth Rate",
     main = "Figure 1.14 in BSDA", col = "pink")
hist(rate1998, breaks = seq(10.9, 21.9, 1.0), xlab = "1998 Birth Rate",
     main = "Figure 1.16 in BSDA", col = "pink", freq = FALSE)
lines(density(rate1998), lwd = 3)
